moves.1. e4 e5 2. Qh5: a very aggressive opening, I was wondering what the plan was
moves.5. Qxc7: As I mentioned him really liking my pawns..
moves.5... Na6 6. Bxa6: my opponent pointed out he also quite liked horses.
moves.6... Qxg2: Luckily enough, I always enjoy those rooks!
moves.14. Nc3: As of this point, I started to almost dislike the game, since my chances are failing.
moves.16... Re8: putting some pressure on the horses.
moves.17... Rg6: just to build up the heat. The bishop at c5 is covered by Ne4×Bc5, Re8×Ne2 (covered by Bg4).
moves.18. Re1 Bh3#: A slightly disappointing, but very relieving end of this good and somewhat scary game.
